pageContext.claim: “Now, the PKK, which is a part of the Kurds, as you know, is probably worse at terror and more of terrorist threat, in many ways, than ISIS.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump appears to be repeating Turkish talking points. The Kurdistan Workers’ Party (PKK) is a separatist group primarily composed of Turkish Kurds with ties to Kurdish militias that have worked with the United States to battle the Islamic State (ISIS). The State Department has labeled the PKK a terrorist organization since 1987 but no serious analysts believe the group is a more serious threat than ISIS. The group has never ranked close to ISIS in number of incidents or casualties.
